conclusion: Each colored inlet at the top (A-cyan, B-yellow, C-blue) starts a stream of liquid that falls under gravity.
The slanted baffles deflect the liquid sideways; at every impact the stream follows the downward‐sloping face of the baffle.
Tracing the path of each color shows where it emerges at the bottom collection gutters that lead either to container D (orange, left) or container E (green, right).
A (cyan) → deflected left twice → arrives above left-hand outlet → flows into container D.
B (yellow) → follows central course → guided left by middle yellow baffle → also reaches left-hand outlet → flows into container D.
C (blue) → remains toward the right after two right-sloping baffles → reaches right-hand outlet → flows into container E.

premise: A (cyan) → deflected left twice → arrives above left-hand outlet → flows into container D.
conclusion: Liquid from A will end up in container D.

premise: B (yellow) → follows central course → guided left by middle yellow baffle → also reaches left-hand outlet → flows into container D.
conclusion: Liquid from B will end up in container D.

premise: C (blue) → remains toward the right after two right-sloping baffles → reaches right-hand outlet → flows into container E.
conclusion: Liquid from C will end up in container E.
